discourse_list.title: EGL project: good, bad or ugly?

content.content: Really strange news today about EGL project, especially having that looks like it is supported by Coinlist and major VCs. Should it be considered as an attempt to improve ETH or a hostile takeover? https://sales.coinlist.co/egl#how-egl-works
content.GPT-summary: The post discusses the EGL project and questions whether it is an attempt to improve ETH or a hostile takeover. The author also mentions that the project is supported by Coinlist and major VCs. The post does not provide a clear opinion on the proposal but rather asks questions and provides constructive criticism.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party or author is advertising proposal

content.content: Thread from Tim on EGL:  twitter.com    Tim Beiko | timbeiko.eth @TimBeiko    One final comment on this: $EGL obviously isn’t the thing that will kill or seriously damage Ethereum, and it’s fairly trivial to neuter, but it is an annoying distraction at a time when core devs + the community are aligned on the #1 priority: the merge. https://t.co/W7s09lr8lU       Tim Beiko | timbeiko.eth @TimBeiko  I think even when trying to be as charitable as possible, e.g. some people advocate for EGL because they think it's better than the current process, the worst offenders here are the ones that make it seem like there was general buy in from the community, specifically @CoinList https://twitter.com/meeseeking/status/1429889286011342848 …    9:40 PM - 23 Aug 2021           177                28
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Here’s a very long thread on the topic:  twitter.com   Q @quentinc137    @mhluongo - @the_matter_labs  @JHancock  @jadler0 - @fuellabs_  @MicahZoltu- @AugurProject  @Epheph @Gnidan - @trufflesuite  @algo_class - @Columbia  @KaushikDonthi -@nethermindeth       Péter Szilágyi (karalabe.eth) @peter_szilagyi  No. That's how you let bad behavior take roots. Seriously though, a community always has a tendency to diverge on external pressure and you either oppose, or there's no way back. Many projects failed like this. It's not a joke, this is a serious issue.    5:27 PM - 22 Aug 2021           55                6
